header.title: 7 Powerful Ways to Fight Ageism… While Getting More from Your Own Life
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: Do you ever feel like 'ageism' is the last 'ism' to be socially acceptable? I do! This is a shame, not only because stereotyping and discriminating against any group of people is wrong… but, also because the world is aging. . . On a practical level, ageism robs society of its connection to the largest and most powerful demographic. . . So, today, I would like to offer 7 powerful ways to fight back against ageism. Along the way, I hope to give you some ideas for how to get more from your life. . . Join us for a cup of tea (or coffee) and a chat. And, if you enjoy the show, please tell one friend about us today. Your support means so much to me! . . Have you (or someone you know) ever experienced ageism? Why do you think that it is still socially acceptable to discriminate against and stereotype older adults? Let's have a chat!. . Here's a link to the article that I mentioned today: https://considerable.com/let-this-ant.... . *****MAKE MORE FRIENDS THIS YEAR!*****. . If you believe in our mission to improve the lives of women over 60, please consider supporting us on Patreon. . . https://www.patreon.com/sixtyandme. . *****GET MORE FROM SIXTY AND ME*****. . SUBSCRIBE to my YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_c.... . Try our gentle yoga videos: http://sixtyandme.com/gentle-yoga-for.... . Get more from Sixty and Me at: http://sixtyandme.com/start
header.socioLingVar: Age - General,Age - Over 65s,Gender - General,Nationality - Italian,Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments

commentThread.commentText: Cindy Gallop spreads great ideas that make a lot of sense. I'll be working and studying hard well into old >age. I see we have political power due to our numbers and our voice. We must advocate for our community's rights. Policies of medical neglect of seniors leading to premature death is an issue to be exposed and disrupted. Mature women in advertising have great value. My female friends are precious to me.
I will be 70 in August! I stopped counting:) Just take one day at a time! All is well!
Ms. Margaret, you are clearly 70 years YOUNG and a huge comfort and inspiration to me. Thank you for the work you do UPLIFTING my mind, heart and soul ⚘.

Good video. I have no problem being 66 what I have is a problem with being called "young lady". I'm proud to have made it this long and don't appreciate being talked down to like that. You are so right about ageism it's out there.
68 and know it's a privilege to age!
I am 68 till December 29th!  I forever adolescent in my maturity!
I'll be 70 in a couple of months.  I think Cindy is on to something.

replies.commentText: me too :-)

commentThread.commentText: Hi there, I'm 54 soon to be 55 on Sunday.  I'm having a difficult time with aging mostly due to perimenopause.. you give me great inspiration as do your wonderful group of subscribers.  Ty!!
Thank you so much for your words on aging and retirement. It is helpful...

i am so relieved and a deeper intimacy with spouse  activity that sprang from a o loss and depression, as we have healed  in that ,our health and outlooks on lots have changed,  being asexual quite surprisingly opens up avenues you never thought of exploring with that person you love. ya ain't gotta have to have lotsa love!!

I'm 70, turning 71 soon. I'm still teaching, too! The kids keep me young. Need to work for six more years is very important! I love my silver hair! I don't like old >woman hair-dos. I roll my own hair. I get up at 5:15 in the morning and go to bed between 9 & 10. I don't support AARP.

replies.commentText: Thanks Cathryne for joining the conversation. Its great to know that you know what you stand for!

commentThread.commentText: I love your vibrant necklace.
63 and retiring from full time  May 31, 2019
I'm sixty and learning how to code.  Keeping fit and healthy by running daily keeping weight And re-inventing myself  to be a better version of myself.
79 and couldn't be happier!

I am 64 as of yesterday April 29 th when you published this video Margaret! Kind of coincidental don't you think? Haha. I have to admit, I paused before adding my age just now. It was more difficult than I thought. I really don't have a problem being 64 , it's looking 64 that I have difficulty with! I have recently joined the ' going grey gracefully ' gang and am happy with that decision. But I was in a store with my 23 year old son the other day and the sales assistant asked him if I was his ' Gramma'! I didn't take it to heart though especially as she wasn't much younger than me and was rather silly, the type of person who speaks before they think. Anyway, not to worry. Thanks again Margaret for another very interesting topic. ❤
And this is the piece that Margaret is talking about: https://considerable.com/let-this-anti-ageism-avenger-help-you-live-your-best-life/ #disruptaging #sayyourage #liveolder

Thank you for this great video, Margaret!  Delighted to see the terrific comments - everyone, do follow me on Twitter @cindygallop, on LinkedIn and on Facebook at facebook.com/cindy.gallop. We're going to change #ageism for all of us! #disruptaging #sayyourage #liveolder
I appreciate you
Also if you keep clean you can feel young.

I turned 75 a few weeks ago. I've been enjoying life more every years since I retired at age 52. I please myself! If I want to let the housework pile up, I just do. If I feel like doing spring cleaning in November, I just do. If I want a meal at 2 in the afternoon, I just do. I am so free, so happy, so self-indulgent after being a parent, a homemaker, an employee. Now I am just myself. I often feel that I've reclaimed the self I was before puberty. Now my body isn't my main focus - I can let my wrinkles show, I can wear what I please. It's so wonderful!
Hi Margaret I'm 63 and don't have a problem with it!!

Hello I am 60, and am happy to be alive. I have chronic illnesses, but I thank God for every day life is so precious! Dont get me wrong I do get down, but we all do from time to time. Many people never get to be 60 so I am shouting it from the roof tops!!
64 I think. I don't think about it anymore. Happy to just be here!
When people ask I say early 100s.  I'm 59

Hi!  I'm 64 and am having trouble finding myself and feeling how so many of you are feeling.  I hope I can get there.  There are several things in my way to get there and they are not in my control.  Just hearing this topic and reading all of your comments helps a lot.  I'm so grateful for this community!

replies.commentText: Ann, I am also 64 and know what you are saying.. I am also feeling the same way

commentThread.commentText: It doesn't bother me a bit to announce my age. I'm proud to be 60! I too, wouldn't want to be young again. I just miss the energy of my younger self. You make 70 look awesome.
63 ,and have time for me,!!!!!💝💙💜💖Never gave up jeans! Never wore double knit pants!
I am 57 and have a hard time aging but this video was very helpful. Thank you!!!

replies.commentText: You look grear Gigi. Just stay positive

commentThread.commentText: When Gloria Steinhem turned 60, a reporter said, "You don't look 60" to which she replied, " Well, this is what 60 looks like".
your necklace is a stunner!,,,
You can disrupt ageing by keep smart and avoid loneliness. Also keep in shape and appropriate fashion.
I wish I was as smart as you at any age.

I will be 70 in August.  At least once a day I will mention that I am almost 70.  I've been gray since I was 40.  I always will tell people when they commented that I should color my hair, I would tell them this is what I  look like and I am ok with it.  I do allow myself a low day or two to look back on what has been and will never be again.  I think it is ok to mourn the loss of fertility or the ability to run any more.  One of the reasons I love water aerobics so much is that I can still move, jump and dance in the water- it's my play time.   I don't give a damm what I look like in a plus size speedo bathing suit as I am dancing to Motown music in class.     I've got more time behind me than in front of me, but I am going to live it until the dance is over.

I turned 60 a few months ago...I enjoy being older. I too have dated younger men..but mostly because that is all that asked me out. I sat around a long time waiting for someone older than me to ask me out until my assistant told me to stop whining that no one was asking me out. He said " I've heard several men ask you out and you say no! Don't you want to have fun?" I was surprised and I went out with the next one who asked me out. It was fun. I realized when we put a number on anything it can be inhibiting. Younger or older. I enjoy people of all ages and I work with them. Sometimes they seem like kids...but that's because I see them making the same mistakes I did. We all learn and grow up which is exciting in itself. I finally have enough confidence to travel to Europe which I don't think I would have done when I was younger!
I am a beautiful age of 55!

You mentioned the advertising agencies are run by men. If you look deeply at who is managing and who they are hiring to design ads, you will discover that the advertising agencies are people in their 30s and 40s. While talking to many of them, I learn that they still think 'retirement' is unplanned and people playing shuffleboard. They may have parents in their 60s and 70s, but they still have a very old fashioned notion of what it looks like to be in our 60s and 70s. The conversations are pretty comical actually.
67 shout it loud and be proud!
I'm 67 and wearing my natural grey proudly!
How about Beauty pageants for older women.

I never had a problem with anyone knowing my age since I never really looked my age. I'm 64 and am living a free and single life since my husband passed away after our 40 years together. I'm not afraid o f sex or love and I want to continue enjoying both.
I am 58
I am  71!
I'm 63 and I'm the happiest I've ever been in my life!😉😁

I ll  be 56 end end of may!  And I have earned even year.!  Although I have a lot of medical problem. I am planing to go to Edinburgh next fall.  On my own.  It has been a life long dream  and now I have the time to do it!

replies.commentText: You will love it! I went to Edinburgh two years ago on my own. Its so pretty. I love traveling by myself. Going to York and London in June. I started travelling at 50. I'll be 57 in October. Enjoy yourself!

commentThread.commentText: I'm 53. I like my age.

dear margaret, i am 62. i have a story, i'll try to be brief. five or so years back my husband and i were on a hike. after a few hours nearing the peak, he set up his tripod and camera and walked into the frame, using the self timer. this would not seem unusual but it was. for 20 years i was positioned in every photograph, always from the back and i knew, only as a way to show perspective of the landscape shots he took. this was a first. i asked what had just happened. (please understand i never cared one bit about being in the photos, i always knew i was just a prop and he had a job to do). he said he was only doing what his editor requested. they wanted young and fit. after overcoming the shock i became angry and hurt. wth! as we continued on our hike i noticed the few people we met on the trail were all around ou r age. on so many levels this was unacceptable and my anger grew. (as he continued to photograph himself while i stood aside) were we not to be recognized as healthy, fit, older adults, active and enjoying the outdoors too? i wanted to know which magazine he meant, i planned write to them. i did do that. and never did hear back. (is a popular well known publication) last year my husband left our marriage for a much young er woman. ironically, as invisible he (and supposedly the magazine) made me feel, i've been asked to model for two company's this last year, now that i'm on my own. even though it's different and way out of my comfort zone to face the camera, i said yes. long silvering hair and wrinkles, made from mostly smiles now...and a growing confidence t hat age doesn't change my value, these are my best assets. your message is so important. we have to believe in ourselves, at e very age. that's what matters most. lori x

replies.commentText: Wow what a wonderful story - you have such composure and grace to have shared it with us- thank you!  His loss. Your gain for sure!!
thank you so much margaret, i'm surprising myself everyday now, it's never too late to start again and be~ embrace! who you are really meant to be. it's scary and exciting but mostly exciting :)

commentThread.commentText: Hi Margaret I think it's great that we can agree to disagree I embrace living.. ;)) Feeling beautiful is inspiring for me Hangout with anyone , regardless of their age To disrupt aging, I think u should just follow your passions. Stop listening to people who want everyone to follow like sheep

replies.commentText: remind me what we are agreeing to disagree on? :-)
Sixty and Me hi Margaret... I don't agree that I am my age... It would be strange if we all agreed on everything.. I enjoy hearing your perspectives

commentThread.commentText: Just turned 69 and I shall disrupt aging by being fierce!  Thank you for this topic Margaret, a good one.
Shouting it out. I will be 70 in a few weeks and am enjoying everday.  I also have transitioned to my natural gray in the last six months and am loving the freedom.  Yea me!

replies.commentText: Yea you!!!

commentThread.commentText: Great message Margaret. Your necklace today is my favorite I've seen you in. You look wonderful. I'm entering the last few years of my 60s . Ageism is a thing. Some cultures do respect their elders but not mine unfortunately. Maturity & wisdom usually only comes with age. Being ourselves is the best way to disrup t ageism. I'm finding myself not due to being a "senior " but due to having time as a retiree due to illness. Battling an incurable disease can change your perspective. That's what's slowed me down but the gift of time I'm trying to use well. Each new day is an opportunity. I can't say I look my age as I've been told I look much younger all my adult life; it's genetics. As my dermatologist says, thank your parents. I get to reflect on my life as well as that of my ancestors. I'm not someone whose ever hid her age. Turning 67 is a gift. Celebrating life! 💃

I disrupt aging by pretty-much ignoring it, though RA reminds me occasionally.  My car has a pedal kayak on top right now, and I have a folding recumbent trike in the back hatch that I bought for my 70th birthday, which was last week.  If I can figure out how to work the cameras, I will post videos of my adventures and show others how easy it is to get exercise and see the world.  Sure, these toys (and the gear to overcome gravity) are pricey, but sell that big ol' house and LIVE!  I moved to a beach shack to afford it.  I'd live in my van, if I had to...

replies.commentText: Happy belated 70th Mary -  your life sounds fabulous and i love the idea of a beach hut! x
@Sixty and Me And the same for you, Margaret!  You often inspire me.  Thank you!

commentThread.commentText: Thank you, Margaret, for another great youtube broadcast ! I am 66 years old. Honestly, I have never thought of myself as old until recently. I retired and found myself watching day time television. Spot on regarding the advertising ! Tuning out from the negative messaging. I have never had any problem with cross generational relationships. I learn from older people, younger people, and I have a lot of wisdom to share. Agree, advertising is not the real world. I'll choose Sixty and Me over the advertising con game. Just my two cents !

replies.commentText: Thanks Julianne!

commentThread.commentText: 72 loving life!
We can disrupt aging by being vibrant and interested in life! Caring and graciously independent.

replies.commentText: Totally agree 1 million percent!

commentThread.commentText: 73 yrs on the planet. I have 2 part time jobs so I can buy or do the things that prompt me. I also garden and love to read in the off season.

Thank you for this!  I am 70, car free in the congested San Francisco Bay area.  Bicycle advocacy over the 15 years here has been amazing...I ride my bike everywhere...take it on BART, Amtrak, Ferry, Light rail, bus...enjoying every day to the max...ride w the kids!  E bike does give me an edge for hauling groceries, leading group rides....still ride the Trek to keep toned...Life is Grand!  I kicked out all the toxic people in my life...that is very freeing!

replies.commentText: Love this! Yes life is grand!!

commentThread.commentText: I think it's great to have younger friends as we can learn from each other. However, I feel that when Cindy says she dates men in their 20s that that is a bit of a double standard. What does that say to older men?  It seems to me that she wants the best of both worlds!  Just my thoughts, love your channel and start my day with you every morning. Thank you Margaret!

replies.commentText: Its a good question - let's see if she answers :-)

commentThread.commentText: I'm happy to live older but also happy to be alive #1.
This is , by far, my favorite video of yours.  Thank you.

replies.commentText: Thanks so much Stephanie!

commentThread.commentText: Hello beautiful lady! I hope that you are doing well. Always enjoy visiting with you. ❤️☕️

Hello! I'm 68 and happy to be alive! I recently let my hair go gray. It feels great and I love it. It has all shades of silver and grey with some black. No more hair dye and no more watching my roots come through. I have a daughter that's only 27. I'm proud of being my age and having the experience and knowledge that comes with aging.
I'm 71,  I love it.  There are two choices, you get older or we die. I'd rather be vertical

replies.commentText: :-) Thanks Joyce - love your perspective!!

commentThread.commentText: Your makeup looks great,  Margaret
True

I am 66 and get very confused about people's reactions to me. I feel good at this stage of my life. I raised my 3 very wonderful children as a single parent and always have been very independant and strong. I am trying to make changes to insure that I will be able to be self sufficient in my future years. It can be very sad and overwhelming sometimes to give up or let go of our past. Changes are not easy. I find that aging is about adjusting to changes in our life. Readjusting our thought process about our future. I do not feel old. Until others treat me like they think I am. I do not color my hair anymore and my hair is mostly white which troubles many people. I wear my hair in a style that is considered too long for my age but I have news for them it's going to get longer. I travel and drive wherever I want to with no one restricting me. I have more freedom than I have at any stage in my life.

replies.commentText: I am doing the same thing with my hair! I am 62, and I don't care what other people think about my hair. I've had comments about how I should not let my hair grow long, "that's for young girls". I don't feel old. Keep on living and feeling good about your life!

commentThread.commentText: Lovely, Grand, Fabulous, Encouraging, Delightful conversation. Thank you so much for sharing this with us and I will definitely be sharing it also. I started painting 6 years ago and I love it so much. I'm 76 🤩 Love and hugs to you, Irene

I like the idea of saying our age with pride. I'm 66! One of the best things I did was cancelling my basis TV pkg. years ago. No more being bombarded with advertisements. I don't buy magazines anymore. Sometimes look at mags in my library instead.

replies.commentText: Toni Wildman my mother is 92 and tells everyone!
@Pamela Goodson Good for her! She's setting a good example for the rest of us!

commentThread.commentText: Hi Margaret, I'm 61 and loving the freedom I have at this time in my life. 😊 I can remember my mother at this age and the clothes and hair styles society expected of her. Things have certainly changed for the better. My hair is longer than it has ever been. I buy my clothes in all manner of shops, not just the ‘old lady' clothing stores and I revel in experiencing new things. Great topic, thanks for starting this conversation. Cheers from Australia.

Hi going 2my granddaughter. Christening on Sunday but i am feeling low at moment about going don't know why I am 70 maybe it is because most of the people are quite young I have never felt like this before any advice .

replies.commentText: Ann OSullivan feel it is then let it go. Hugs.

Ann OSullivan   Like Margaret said 'hang out with the younger people'. They are simply 'younger'. Enjoy the celebration. Just think....and appreciate......you have contributed to expanding life to two more generations. What an amazing contribution to our world.
Thank u .

commentThread.commentText: I love the concept that my age is a sum total of who I am. I am 67 and an active ageism disrupter. In particular, I am a 'retirement' disrupter. The expectation that retirement is a natural choice for everyone at a particula r age reinforces a false perception that our talents and contribution are no longer valuable. Far from reality. We are valuable contributors and fair exchange for our expertise and experience is not only appropriate, but is our right. Regarding the point about using 'for my age', I am guilty especially in response to pressures to look younger. I often respond ' I don't want to look 10 years younger, I want to look good for my age'. When I deconstruct the message, I realize that it insidiously supp orts ageism. Hence, my retort is now going to be 'I want to look and feel good'. Full stop. No 'just' or 'good enough'. Simply, elegantly, and confidently 'I want to look and feel good'. So now I'm off to put in a good day's work for a client with breaks for a walk and a yoga class. All pumped up and inspired. Thank you Margaret.

replies.commentText: Patricia Muir love your message. U sound like someone I could get along with. Love your quote retirement disrupter!! Live long and prosper Pat!

Julie S   Thank you for your comment Julie!  It's so inspiring to connect with women like you. I invite you to check out my YouTube channel where I interview women who enjoy their work after sixty. Are you Margaret's Patreon channel? It's a great place to connect. All my best wishes...Patricia

commentThread.commentText: An add on comment! I love being aware of 'looking' our age is okay! It's actually freeing!

Hi Margaret, greetings from NC.  I love the way you present topics.  I loved my sixties and now that I'm in my early 70s enjoying them even more!  Yes, there are challenges but adapting and creating new pathways to a full life as we journey on is part of living a good life! I'm 72!

replies.commentText: Carol Genovese 🌸oh HOW !!!! TEACH US HOW !!!! IM 62 and Never felt my age until this year ! I've just have seized up health bones skin ! I don't want this ! I want how you expressed ! I haven't any one in family how to Grow Older with Grace ! I feel like a old car left out in a empty field! RUSTY !!! With Care and open Heart and Ears listening! Debra 🌸

commentThread.commentText: Fabulous conversation today! Disrupt aging! I want to scream it from the roof tops! (But I probably won't 😝) I try to live and engage! Dress to suit myself. Hike, swim , yoga. Go out with friends. Just be present in every moment. Keep moving forward. I have a mental vision of expanding.

replies.commentText: Julie S Hello Julie. I love your mental vision of expanding!

commentThread.commentText: Fabulous vlog Margaret!!! Thank you!!!

replies.commentText: Hi Flossy thanks for your kind words!  You can also check out our other channels at www.sixtyandme.com/start - have a fabulous day!

commentThread.commentText: Thanks so much my beautiful friend!!

replies.commentText: Thanks Willine wonderful to have you here!
